projects.title: FinAdvisor - Financial Advisory Tool
projects.description: The FinAdvisor project leverages AI and LLMs with Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) using QLoRA to deliver personalized financial advice efficiently. Real-time financial data from Alpaca News API and Hugging Face datasets is preprocessed and stored in Qdrant for retrieval. LoRA fine-tunes the model for financial contexts, ensuring accuracy and scalability. Deployed via a RESTful API with a Gradio interface, the tool provides real-time insights into budgeting, investments, and credit management.

projects.title: Harvard Agriculture Datathon 2024
projects.description: Explored the relationship between aging farmer demographics and agricultural production across the U.S. by analyzing crop sales data and adjusting for inflation to understand the economic impact. Uncovered regional trends and assessed how the rising average age of farmers affected future food production and sustainability.

projects.title: LyricLab - Ed Sheeran Lyrics Generator
projects.description: The LyricLab project explores the fascinating task of generating song lyrics using Natural Language Processing (NLP) and machine learning. By working with a dataset of 111 unique Ed Sheeran songs, the team analyzes a vocabulary of 4,632 unique words and over 62,000 tokens to develop and compare various models. The project leverages Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to implement techniques like Naive Bayes N-Gram models, RNNs with LSTM architecture, and GPT-2 Transformers. Key efforts include creating trigram probability graphs, calculating perplexity, and training models to predict and generate new lyrics. The results are evaluated using metrics like ROUGE scores and perplexity, shedding light on the strengths and limitations of each approach, from the simplicity of N-Grams to the advanced capabilities of GPT-2. This project not only pushes the boundaries of text generation but also highlights challenges like overfitting and model biases in creative AI applications‚Äã

projects.title: ShopServe E-Commerce platform
projects.description: ShopServe is a country-specific e-commerce platform that connects customers, sellers, and shippers through tailored user accounts, enabling product management, secure transactions, and integrated delivery services. It employs Flask for web development, MySQL for database management, and HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript for a responsive UI, with Jinja for dynamic content rendering. Data generation uses Python's faker library to populate the database, while stored procedures and functions facilitate efficient CRUD operations and business logic automation.

projects.title: Article Recommendation System
projects.description: The Article Recommendation System is designed to provide personalized article suggestions, ensuring readers stay engaged with content that matches their interests. It uses a combination of techniques like content-based filtering (analyzing article keywords with TF-IDF), collaborative filtering (leveraging user behavior and preferences), and a hybrid model that blends both approaches for better accuracy. The project also incorporates advanced tools like K-Means clustering, SVD, and kernel PCA for improving recommendations and visualizing patterns. Built with Python, it focuses on delivering meaningful and tailored recommendations that adapt to users' evolving preference

projects.title: Diabetes Prediction using Machine Learning
projects.description: The Early Diabetes Prediction project focuses on identifying the best machine learning models to predict diabetes accurately using the Pima Indian Diabetes Dataset. Preprocessing steps like missing value removal and feature subset selection were applied to enhance data quality. Models like Support Vector Machines, Logistic Regression, Random Forest, and Decision Trees were trained and evaluated. Additionally, a Soft Voting Classifier was implemented to combine model predictions for improved accuracy. The project emphasizes feature importance, performance comparisons, and efficient classification for early diabetes detection.

experience.title: Data Science and Analytics Summer Intern
content: Conducted in-depth analysis of payments data, uncovering key insights that were leveraged by the sales team to secure three new clients, contributing to a 20% increase in revenue, and further optimizing fraud detection strategies.

Analyzed historical payment patterns and outliers using Python, leading to actionable insights that drove a 10% reduction in default rates, and further implemented data-driven strategies that significantly improved risk management by 25%

Worked on its entity resolution model that leverages the Expectation Maximization Algorithm to create a persistent ID that facilitates deduplication and eliminates data redundancy, leading to a 30% increase in fraudulent transaction identification

experience.title: Data Science Co-Op
content: Developed an algorithm to identify critical issues in Oracle databases and Snowflake data lakes. Performed statistical data analysis using Spark, extracted actionable insights with Tableau, and achieved a 40% improvement in accuracy and efficiency.

Conducted exploratory data analysis (EDA) on cross-functional data from multiple sources, integrated SQL and NoSQL databases for customer escalation prediction across 50+ product families, and improved prediction accuracy by 15%.

Designed and prototyped an end-to-end machine learning model to evaluate performance metrics, and created insightful Power BI dashboards. Visualized insights using R and Python alongside maintaining, and deploying the model on AWS cloud.

experience.title: Research Intern
content: Implemented measures including node attestation, cloud service identity, and authentication, leveraging CNCF's SPIRE and SPIFFE technologies, resulting in a 20% security enhancement.
Built a secure zero-trust environment, simulated the workload API interaction and data retrieval using a python script in a docker container.
Secured 3rd place in HPE CTY program and won a research grant.
